data.title: The Guardian US editorial team
data.meta_description: A list of editorial team members working for the Guardian in the US
data.text:
See a full list of management in the US

Guardian US has offices in New York, San Francisco and Washington DC. Search for editorial staff by their last name.

A - C

Lauren Aratani, reporter, New York

Lauren is a reporter for the Guardian US. She joined the Guardian in 2018.

lauren.aratani@theguardian.com | @LaurenAratani

Lois Beckett, senior reporter, San Francisco

Lois has reported on gun politics, gun violence, and the far right for The Guardian since 2016. She previously worked as an investigative reporter at ProPublica.

lois.beckett@theguardian.com | @loisbeckett

Max Benwell, audience engagement editor

Before joining the Guardian US in 2018, Max worked for the Independent as an assistant audience editor and commissioning editor on the comment desk

max.benwell@theguardian.com | @Max_Benwell

Johana Bhuiyan, senior tech reporter and editor

Johana is a senior tech reporter and editor for the Guardian US

johana.bhuiyan@theguardian.com

Julian Borger, world affairs editor, Washington DC

Julian has been a correspondent for the Guardian in Poland, Bosnia and Jerusalem. He is the author of The Butcher’s Trail: How the Search for Balkan War Criminals Became the World’s Most Successful Manhunt

julian.borger@theguardian.com | @julianborger

Gabrielle Canon, freelance reporter, Los Angeles

Gabrielle is a freelance reporter for the Guardian US.

gabrielle.canon@theguardian.com

Matthew Cantor, copy editor, San Francisco

Matthew Cantor is a copy editor and occasional writer for the Guardian’s west coast bureau.

matthew.cantor@theguardian.com | @cantormatthew

Mona Chalabi, data editor, New York

Mona is data editor for Guardian US. She previously worked at the Bank of England, the Economist Intelligence Unit, Transparency International and the International Organisation for Migration.

mona.chalabi@theguardian.com | @MonaChalabi

Ashley Chervinski, deputy production editor, New York

Ashley is the deputy production editor for Guardian US.

ashley.chervinski@theguardian.com | @ashleycherv

J Oliver Conroy, assistant opinion editor, New York

J Oliver Conroy is an editor on the Guardian’s US opinion desk. He also writes occasional reported features and profiles.

Please read the Guardian US opinion pitch guidelines.

oliver.conroy@guardian.co.uk |

Will Craft, data editor, New York

Will Craft is data editor for Guardian US.

will.craft@theguardian.com

Caitlin Curran, production editor, New York

Caitlin Curran is the production editor for the Guardian US.

caitlin.curran@theguardian.com | @cecurran

D - F

Kerry Eustice, managing editor, New York

Before moving to New York, Kerry oversaw the 10 education and society professional networks at the Guardian in London.

kerry.eustice@theguardian.com | @kerryeustice

Gail Fletcher, photo editor, New York

Gail Fletcher is the photo editor for Guardian US.

gail.fletcher@theguardian.com | @thefletchinator

Jakub Frankowicz, digital producer, New York

Jakub Frankowicz is a digital producer for Guardian US.

jakub.frankowicz@theguardian.com

Amana Fontanella-Khan, opinion editor, New York

Amana Fontanella-Khan is the opinion editor. She previously worked as editor on the Reuters opinion page. Before moving to New York, she reported out of Brussels, New Delhi and Mumbai. She is the author of Pink Sari Revolution a book on women’s rights in India.

Please read the Guardian US opinion pitch guidelines

amana.fontanella-khan@theguardian.com | @AmanaFK

G - I

Adam Gabbatt, writer and presenter, New York

Adam Gabbatt is a writer and presenter for Guardian US, based in New York. He won a journalism bursary from the Scott Trust, the company that owns the Guardian, in 2008.

adam.gabbatt@theguardian.com | @adamgabbatt

Lauren Gambino, senior political correspondent, Washington DC

Lauren is a senior political reporter in Washington DC where she covers campaigns and Congress. She previously covered the 2016 presidential election and the 2018 congressional midterm elections. She is a graduate of ASU’s Walter Cronkite School of Journalism and Mass Communication and a 2011-12 Fullbright scholar.

lauren.gambino@theguardian.com | @LaurenEGambino

Frida Garza, assistant special series editor, New York

Frida joined Guardian US in 2020. She has previously written for Jezebel and Quartz.

frida.garza@theguardian.com | @fffffrida

Alastair Gee, special series editor, New York

Alastair is editor of special series at Guardian US and the co-author of Fire in Paradise: An American Tragedy, based on his wildfire reporting for the Guardian.

alastair.gee@theguardian.com | @alastairgee

Jessica Glenza, health reporter, New York

Jessica is the health reporter for Guardian US. She covers a broad range of issues, with a special focus on reproductive rights.

jessica.glenza@theguardian.com | @JessicaGlenza

Eline Gordts, deputy west coast editor, San Francisco

Before joining the Guardian as deputy editor on the west coast, Eline worked as a deputy enterprise editor, assignment editor and senior world editor at HuffPost.

eline.gordts@theguardian.com | @elinegordts

Bryan Graham, deputy sports editor, New York

Bryan Armen Graham is the deputy sports editor of Guardian US, based in New York. He has previously written for Sports Illustrated, the Atlantic and the Village Voice.

bryan.graham@theguardian.com | @BryanAGraham

Joan E Greve, reporter, Washington DC

Joan E Greve is a politics breaking news reporter for Guardian US, based in Washington. She anchors the Guardian’s US politics live blog, and she previously worked for the Washington Post.

joan.greve@theguardian.com | @joanegreve

Martin Hodgson, international editor, New York

Martin is responsible for international coverage for Guardian US. He joined the Guardian as an assistant news editor in 2009, and before that worked as a freelance reporter and foreign correspondent.

martin.hodgson@theguardian.com | @martinxhodgson

Adrian Horton

Adrian Horton joined the Guardian US as an arts writer in 2019. Prior to that, she was a Guardian US news fellow and health reporter in Northwest Montana.

adrian.horton@theguardian.com | @adrian_horton

Michael Hudson, head of US investigations, New York

Michael Hudson is head of US investigations at the Guardian US

michael.hudson@theguardian.com

J - L

Nina Lakhani, environmental justice reporter, New York

Before joining Guardian US full time, Nina was a freelance stringer reporting from Mexico and Central America for over 6 years, and before that she was a staff reporter covering health and social justice for the Independent newspapers in London.

nina.lakhani@theguardian.com

Oliver Laughland, senior reporter, New York

Oliver is a senior reporter for Guardian US. He was previously a reporter for the Guardian in Australia where his investigations into immigration detention and Australia’s treatment of asylum seekers won multiple awards.

oliver.laughland@theguardian.com | @oliverlaughland

Sam Levin, reporter, Los Angeles

Sam was a senior staff writer at the East Bay Express in Oakland, California, and has previously written for the Riverfront Times, the Village Voice and New York Daily News.

sam.levin@theguardian.com | @SamTLevin

Andrew Lawrence, culture writer

Andrew is a culture writer for the Guardian US.

andrew.lawrence@theguardian.com

Sam Levine, reporter, New York

Sam Levine is a reporter at the Guardian covering voting rights in America. He previously worked at HuffPost and attended the University of Chicago.

sam.levine@theguardian.com | @srl

Rita Liu, assistant visual editor, New York

Rita Liu is an assistant visual editor and illustrator.

rita.liu@guardian.co.uk

Tom Lutz, sport editor, New York

Tom is sport editor for Guardian US, a position he previously held for Guardian Australia. He has worked for the Guardian since 2003.

tom.lutz@theguardian.com | @tom_lutz

M - O

Justin Madden, deputy editor, West Coast, Los Angeles

Justin is deputy editor, West Coast for the Guardian US.

justin.madden@theguardian.com

Chris McGreal, freelance reporter, Washington DC

Chris McGreal is a freelance writer for the Guardian.

chris.mcgreal@guardian.co.uk

Malik Meer, west coast editor, San Francisco

Before moving to California, Malik was assistant editor at The Observer and prior to that he served as features editor of The Guardian.

malik.meer@theguardian.com

Oliver Milman, environment reporter, New York

Oliver is an environment reporter at the Guardian US. Prior to joining the NY office, he was a reporter and freelance contributor for Guardian Australia. He was also editor of the website StartupSmart.com.au.

oliver.milman@theguardian.com| @olliemilman

Francisco Navas, digital producer, New York

Francisco is a producer and occasional writer at the Guardian.

francisco.navas@theguardian.com | @fnavas5

Poppy Noor, senior staff writer, New York

Poppy Noor is a senior staff writer in New York.

poppy.noor@theguardian.com | @poppynoor

Gloria Oladipo, reporter

Gloria is a reporter for Guardian US.

gloria.oladipo@theguardian.com

Mark Oliver, environment editor, New York

Mark edits climate and environment editorial and was previously a special projects editor, joining Guardian US in 2016. He previously worked as a news and projects editor for the Guardian in London.

mark.oliver@theguardian.com

P - R

Kari Paul, reporter, San Francisco

Kari Paul is a technology reporter for the Guardian US. She lives in Oakland and previously worked at Dow Jones and VICE media.

kari.paul@theguardian.com | @kari_paul

Martin Pengelly, breaking news/weekend editor, New York

Martin is responsible for news coverage on Saturdays and Sundays. He has worked for the Guardian since 2004. Previously, he worked for the Independent and the Independent on Sunday.

martin.pengelly@theguardian.com | @MartinPengelly

Ed Pilkington, chief reporter, New York

Ed is chief reporter for Guardian US, reporting from New York since 2006. He has been both national and foreign editor of the Guardian. He is author of Beyond the Mother Country.

ed.pilkington@theguardian.com | @Edpilkington

Ankita Rao, news editor, New York

Ankita Rao is a news editor at The Guardian.

ankita.rao@theguardian.com | @anrao

Betsy Reed, editor of Guardian US

betsy.reed@theguardian.com

Jessica Reed, head of narrative, associate editor, New York

She previously worked as opinion editor for Guardian Australia and also worked for five years in the Guardian’s London office.

She likes to receive emails with excellent ideas (here’s how to pitch to her).

jessica.reed@theguardian.com | @guardianjessica

Edwin Rios, senior reporter, racial equity, San Francisco

Edwin Rios is the senior reporter, racial equity, for Guardian US.

edwin.rios@theguardian.com

Dominic Rushe, business editor, New York

Dominic has been based in New York since 2001. He was part of the team awarded the 2014 Pulitzer prize for public service for groundbreaking articles on NSA surveillance.

dominic.rushe@theguardian.com | @dominicru

S - U

Erum Salam, digital producer, New York

Erum is a producer and reporter at the Guardian.

erum.salam@theguardian.com | @salamdogmillion

Tom Silverstone, video editor, New York

Tom Silverstone is a filmmaker at the Guardian covering politics, culture and society.

tom.silverstone@theguardian.com | @TomSilverstone

Maanvi Singh, reporter, San Francisco

Maanvi covers politics, as well as health and environmental issues. She previously worked as a reporter for NPR.

maanvi.singh@theguardian.com | @maanvisings

David Smith, Washington bureau chief, Washington DC

David is the Guardian’s senior Washington correspondent. He was previously Africa correspondent for the Guardian.

david.smith@theguardian.com | @smithinamerica

Jane Spencer, deputy editor and head of strategy, New York

Jane Spencer is deputy editor and head of strategy at the Guardian US. Previously, she was executive editor of The Daily Beast and editor-in-chief at Fusion Media Group. She was part of a Wall Street Journal team that won the Pulitzer Prize in 2007 for a series on China’s health and environment challenges.

jane.spencer@theguardian.com | @janebspencer

Aliya Uteuova, visual reporter, New York

Aliya Uteuova is a visual reporter covering environmental justice.

aliya.uteuova@theguardian.com | @aliyaute

V - Z

Andrew Witherspoon, interactive data journalist, New York

Andrew Witherspoon is an interactive data journalist for Guardian US.

andrew.witherspoon@guardian.co.uk

Richard Wolffe, columnist

Richard Wolffe is a columnist for the Guardian. He is the author of Renegade: The Making of a President, Revival: The Struggle for Survival Inside the Obama White House and The Message: The Re-Selling of President Obama.

richard.wolffe@theguardian.com | @richardwolffedc

Julia Carrie Wong, senior technology reporter, San Francisco

Julia Carrie Wong is senior technology reporter for the Guardian US. She previously worked as a staff writer for SF Weekly.

julia.wong@theguardian.com | @juliacarriew

Noa Yachot, US membership editor, New York

Before joining the Guardian, Noa Yachot was senior editor at the American Civil Liberties Union. She previously worked in the Middle East, as the managing editor of +972 Magazine and a head news editor at Haaretz.
